lines.text:
[singing]
His royal highness Christopher Rupert son of his majesty King Maximillian Godfree Ladeslous Leapold Sydney.

[speaking in unison]
Sydney?

[speaking]
Sydney.
[singing]
Frederick John is giving a ball.
Ah, yes! I noticed the pomp! But she has a circumstance that I cannot abide.
And what is that, Your Highness?
She creaks.

[singing]
His royal highness Christopher Rupert Windemier Vladamier Carl Alexander Francois Reginald Lancelot Herman.

[speaking]
Herman?

[speaking]
Herman.
[singing]
Gregory James is giving a ball.

[singing]
His royal highness Christopher Rupert son of her majesty Queen Constantina Charlotte Ermintrude Guenivere Mazie.

[speaking]
Mazie?

[speaking]
Mazie.
[singing]
Marguerite Anne is giving a ball.
A woman given to sudden, mysterious appearances and disappearances seems to me to lack the first qualification for a queen.
And what is that, my lord?
She should not disappear into thin air.
Oh, I am certain that once married, she would settle down.
[last lines]

[singing]
Impossible things are happening every day!
What is your name, lass?
I am called Cinderella.
And why are you called that?
Because I sit among the ashes.
And why do you do that?
To warm my feet. You see, sir, I sleep in the attic where it's always cold.
And why do you sleep in the attic?
The other rooms are occupied by my stepmother and my stepsisters.
And where does your father sleep?
In heaven.
I have a strange feeling that we have met before. That I have heard your voice before. Is that possible?
It's possible. Yes, everything is possible tonight!
Everything is different. Everything has changed since you came. I have never felt this way before.
Nor I.
Did anyone call while we were away?
Yes, ma'am.
Who was it?
Only a traveler who stopped for a dipper of water.
And you gave it to him?
Yes, ma'am.
I told you never to open that door while we were away!
But he was so thirsty, and his smile was so kind.

[coldly]
Go to your corner, and stay there till you're called.
Yes, ma'am.
It would not be so bad if I saw them as fair young maidens.
How else do you see them?
As contenders for a prize and I am the prize.
[first lines]
We are in sight of the towers of home and your father's palace.
It hardly seems like we've been gone for an entire year.
I sent messengers ahead to tell of your arrival.
I am dying of thirst. Let us stop at that cottage.
You, Prunella, your knee creaks.
I cannot help it, Mother.
Yes, you can. Rub some unicorn oil into it. Whoever hopes to marry the prince must be perfect.
